headline: Aston Villa Women sign Sabrina D’Angelo
summary: Aston Villa have signed 31-year-old goalkeeper Sabrina D’Angelo who previously spent a season and a half with Arsenal. D’Angelo played 15 times for the Gunners and is currently with the Canada at the Olympic Games. […]

headline: Arsenal Women sign Dutch goalkeeper Daphne van Domselaar
summary: Arsenal have confirmed the signing of Netherlands international goalkeeper Daphne van Domselaar from Aston Villa. The 24-year-old, who has represented her country at the 2022 Euros and 2023 World Cup, played 15 times for Villa […]

headline: London City Lionesses sign Serbian international Miljana Ivanović
summary: London City Lionesses sign Serbian international Miljana Ivanović from LSK Kvinner on a four-year contract. The 24-year-old forward, who has over 15 caps for her country, joins after scoring seven goals in twelve Norwegian Toppserien […]

headline: Lionesses to host Germany and USA at Wembley
summary: England Women have lined up four friendlies starting with Germany at Wembley on Friday 25 October 2024. Four days later, the Lionesses take on South Africa at Coventry City FC, with USA visiting Wembley on […]

headline: Scottish Women’s Football League expands to fifth division
summary: The regional Scottish Women’s Football League is to expand to five sections from 2024/25 to accommodate new teams springing up across Scotland. The fifth tier of women’s football in Scotland will now comprise of SWFL […]

headline: Ballymoney United Ladies and Greenisland beat higher division teams
summary: Ballymoney United Ladies, Bangor, Belfast Celtic and Greenisland reach the Local Women’s Sport Super Cup Semi-Finals. NIWFA Championship leaders Sion Swifts went into their home tie as favourites but Belfast Celtic ripped up the form […]

headline: 2024/25 Genero Adran Trophy draw
summary: The 16 clubs from the North and South divisions have discovered their opponents in the Genero Adran Trophy group stage. The top two teams from the regionalised group draw will go through to the round […]

headline: Everton Women sign Spain international Inma Gabarro
summary: Everton have signed highly-rated 21-year-old Spanish international Inma Gabarro from her childhood club Seville. Capable of playing across the forward line as well as in midfield, Gabarro helped Spain win the FIFA U-20 Women’s World […]
